issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: It turns out that empyrean-describe-node-controllers has been sending its DescribeInstances requests to the empyrean endpoint -- and succeeding, too.  It should probably stop relying on that.
fields.summary: empyrean-describe-node-controllers relies on empyrean service answering EC2 requests

comments.body: This is fixed in commit {{70f06d8}}.  The effect of this change is visible in --debug output.

Verified.

{noformat}
[root@d-03 ~]# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials`

[root@d-03 ~]# empyrean-describe-node-controllers --ec2-url http://compute.d-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
NODE  one  10.111.5.134  enabled
INSTANCE  i-cf3fd6e7
NODE  one  10.111.5.200  enabled
{noformat}

{{--debug}} output:
{noformat}
